title: Tarsus was the capital of the Roman province of Cilicia and, according to Acts 9: 11, it is the birthplace of the Roman citizen Saul of Tarsus, who became the apostle Saint Paul, a leading figure in the early missions of Christianity. The region around Tarsus had a population that was mostly Armenian and Christian; various Muslim and Byzantine rulers had sought to control the region until 1080, when Ruben I, a prince of Armenia, established an independent kingdom of Cilicia with its capital at Tarsus
